creator: chealer@gmail.com
text:
http://httpd.apache.org/ ends with:
>Please ensure that you verify your downloads using PGP or MD5 signatures

This last sentence is missing a period.

Since the download page already recommends verification, this sentence is superfluous. I would recommend simply removing it.

Apologies for the wrong metadata. I couldn't find an appropriate way to file a ticket about httpd.apache.org.

Hi Filipus!

Home page updated! I do believe that the sentence should stay there, there is no harm in reminding best practices to people multiple times in my opinion :)

Let me know!

Luca
creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com

text:
Hi Luca,
Reminding people after a month may be useful. Reminding after a few seconds seems unlikely to help IMO.

Thanks
creator: chealer@gmail.com
